translated: Ten Categories of the SÄá¹ƒkhya School in One Fascicle
Composed by ÄªÅ›varaká¹›á¹£á¹‡a
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
There are ten categories.

First, substance; second, quality; third, action; fourth, generality; fifth, particularity; sixth, aggregation; seventh, inherence; eighth, non-existence; ninth, inherence of non-existence; tenth, non-apprehension.
What is the category of substance?
It refers to the nine kinds of substance, which are called the category of substance.
What are the nine?
First, earth; second, water; third, fire; fourth, wind; fifth, space; sixth, time; seventh, direction; eighth, self; ninth, mind.
These are the nine substances.
What is earth?
It refers to that which has form, taste, smell, and touch, which is earth.
What is water? It refers to that which has form, taste, touch, and fluidity, which is water.
What is fire? It refers to that which has form and touch, which is fire.
What is wind? It refers to that which only has touch, which is wind.
What is space? It refers to that which only has sound, which is space.
Time is that which distinguishes the simultaneity or non-simultaneity, slowness or quickness of this and that. The cause for distinguishing is time.
Direction is that which distinguishes the east, south, west, north, etc. The cause for distinguishing is direction.
Self is that which arises with the knowledge of the combination of joy, suffering, desire, anger, diligence, good and evil dharmas as its characteristic.
Mind is that which arises with the knowledge of the non-combination of joy, suffering, desire, anger, diligence, good and evil dharmas as its characteristic.
What is the meaning of the word quality?
The twenty-four qualities are called the meaning of the word quality.
What are the twenty-four qualities?

First, color; second, taste; third, smell; fourth, touch; fifth, number; sixth, measure; seventh, distinct entity; eighth, combination; ninth, separation; tenth, that entity; eleventh, this entity; twelfth, cognition; thirteenth, pleasure; fourteenth, pain; fifteenth, desire; sixteenth, aversion; seventeenth, effort; eighteenth, heavy entity; nineteenth, liquid entity; twentieth, moisture; twenty-first, action; twenty-second, dharma; twenty-third, non-dharma; twenty-fourth, sound.
Thus, there are twenty-four qualities.
What is color? It is only what is grasped by the eye, one basis called color.ğŸ”½What is taste? It is only what is grasped by the tongue, one basis called taste.
What is smell? It is only what is grasped by the nose, one basis called smell.
What is touch? It is only what is grasped by the skin, one basis called touch.
What is number? It is the cause for the cognition of all real unities and pluralities, such as one, two, etc., called number.
What is measure? It is smallness, largeness, shortness, longness, roundness, etc., called measure.
What is smallness?
That is to say, the two subtle fruits are taken as the cause and condition of combination.
Generated by the two substances.
The one real subtle characterization of the cause is called the short substance.
As for the long substance,
It is the long substance caused by many substances.
The combination of the three subtle fruits generated by the differences in accumulation,
The one real great characterization of the cause is called the great substance.
As for the short substance, the two subtle fruits are taken as the cause and condition of combination, generated by the two substances.
The one real short characterization of the cause is called the short substance.
As for the long substance,
It is the long substance caused by many substances.
The combination of the three subtle fruits generated by the differences in accumulation, the one real long characterization of the cause is called the long substance.
As for the round substance,
There are two kinds.
One is the extreme subtlety, the other is the extreme largeness.
As for the extreme subtlety,
It is the combination of the extreme subtlety, the one real extreme subtle characterization of the cause is called the extreme subtlety.
As for the extreme largeness,
Namely, space, time, direction, self, real, combined, one, real, extremely large, and the reason for the name is also called omnipresent, etc. This is called extremely large.
What is the separate substance?
Namely, all real, combined, one, not one, real, separate reason, one, separate substance, etc. This is called separate substance.
What is combination?
Namely, the two not reaching and reaching at the same time is called combination.
This has three kinds: one arising from a single action, two arising from both actions, and three arising from combination.
Arising from a single action means
arising from having movement to not having movement.ğŸ”½Arising from both actions means
arising from both kinds of having movement.
Arising from combination means
when many realities arise without movement, they combine with space, etc.
What is separation? Namely, from the two reaching to not reaching is called separation.
This has three kinds: one arising from a single action, two arising from both actions, and three arising from separation.
Among them, arising from a single action and arising from both actions are explained as combination before.
Separation from arising refers to that which is already produced by the cause of the real, separated from other causes, not waiting for the destruction of the real, and equal to emptiness.

What is its essence? It refers to that which is produced by the one real that is waited upon by the distant cognition of the same time, etc. The cause that is the condition for that is called its essence.
What is this essence? It refers to that which is produced by the one real that is waited upon by the near cognition of the same time, etc.
The cause that is the condition for that is called this essence.
What is cognition? It refers to the understanding of all objects.
There are two kinds of this: direct perception and inference.
Direct perception refers to the arising of a conceptual image when the sense faculties, etc. unite with the real object, etc. This is called direct perception.
Inference is of two kinds.
One is inference based on similarity, and the other is inference based on dissimilarity.

Inference based on similarity refers to the arising of knowledge regarding an unseen object that is similar to the seen object, based on the similarity of characteristics, the relation between the characteristic and the characterized, and the combination of one's own mind.ğŸ”½This is called inference based on similarity.

Not seeing the same means that one sees the causal relationship between cause and effect, the unity of meaning, and the contradiction of combination. Therefore, it depends on the relationship between them, and the combination of one's own mind.
The arising of cognition regarding the ultimately unseen object is called not seeing the same and inferring.
What is pleasure? It means the essence of the virtue of the one real self, which delights itself, is called pleasure.
What is pain? It means the essence of the virtue of the one real self, which afflicts itself, is called pain.
What is desire? It means the desire for form, etc., which arises from the combination of the one real self, is called desire.
What is hatred? It means the harm towards form, etc., which arises from the combination of the one real self, is called hatred.

What is diligence? It means the exertion that arises from the combination of the one real self, the desire, and hatred, and the combination of one's own mind, is called diligence.ğŸ”½What is heaviness? It means the cause of the one real self falling down, which arises from the combination of earth, water, etc., is called heaviness.
What is fluidity? It means the cause of the one real self flowing, which arises from the combination of earth, water, fire, etc., is called fluidity.
What is moisture? It refers to water, which is a real entity. It is a single real entity that is included in the cause of moisture.
What is action? There are two kinds: the cause of recollection and the cause of activity.

The cause of recollection refers to the self, which is a single real entity that is combined with the recollection that arises from the practice of direct cognition and the distinctions of repeated cultivation. This is called the cause of recollection.

The cause of activity refers to the power of momentum that arises from activities such as churning and throwing, which is attached to a single real entity with resistance. This is called the cause of activity.
Action refers to momentum.
What is dharma? There are two kinds: that which can transform and that which can return.

That which can transform refers to the cause of pleasant bodies, etc., and happiness, which is the self, a single real entity that is combined with the opposite of the effect. This is called that which can transform.

That which can return refers to the cause of joy from the conditions of detachment and right knowledge, which is the self, a single real entity that is combined with the opposite of the effect. This is called that which can return.
What is non-dharma? It refers to the cause of unpleasant bodies, etc., suffering, and wrong knowledge,
which is the self, a single real entity that is combined with the opposite of the effect. This is called non-dharma.
What is sound? It is only what is grasped by the ear, called sound.
What is the meaning of action? It is the five kinds of actions called the meaning of action.
What are the five? They are the action of grasping, the action of releasing, the action of bending, the action of stretching, and the action of moving.
What is the action of grasping? It is the cause of combining or separating atoms in space, etc., above and below, etc., based on one real entity, called the action of grasping.
What is the action of releasing? It is the cause of separating or combining atoms in space, etc., above and below, etc., based on one real entity, called the action of releasing.

What is the action of bending? It is the cause of combining or separating based on one real entity, with the near place combining and the far place separating, in a long and large real entity, called the action of bending.

What is the action of stretching? It is the cause of separating or combining based on one real entity, with the near place separating and the far place combining, in a long and large real entity, called the action of stretching.
What is the action of moving? It is the cause of combining or separating based on one real entity, in all obstructed real entities that are combined, called the action of moving.
What is the meaning of the same? It is the nature of existence.
What is existence? It refers to the combination with all real qualities and actions, and is grasped by all faculties.
The cause for the knowledge that interprets the existence of real qualities and actions is called existence.
What is the meaning of difference? It refers to the eternal, which depends on a single reality.
It is the cause for negating that cognition and expressing this cognition, and is called the meaning of difference.
What is the meaning of combination? It refers to causing the reality, etc., to be inseparable and related. This is the cause for the knowledge that interprets it.
Moreover, existence is called the meaning of combination.
What is the meaning of capability? It refers to the combination of reality, qualities, and actions, which are not created by a single [entity], but each necessarily produces its own effect.
This is called the meaning of capability.
What is the meaning of incapability? It refers to the combination of reality, qualities, and actions, which are not created by a single [entity], but do not necessarily produce other effects.
This is called the meaning of incapability.

What is the meaning of the common part? It refers to the nature of reality, the nature of qualities, the nature of actions, and their single meaning, such as the nature of earth, the nature of form, and the nature of grasping.
This is called the meaning of the common part.
The nature of reality refers to the combination of all realities, the cause for the cognition of reality in all realities.
It does not apply to qualities and actions, and is grasped by eye contact. This is called the nature of reality.
The nature of qualities refers to the combination of all qualities, the cause for the cognition of qualities in all qualities.
It does not apply to realities and actions, and is grasped by all faculties. This is called the nature of qualities.
The nature of actions refers to the combination of all actions, the cause for the cognition of actions in all actions.
It does not apply to realities and qualities, and is grasped by eye contact. This is called the nature of actions.
The nature of earth and so forth is also like this.
What is the meaning of the inexpressible? It refers to the five kinds of inexpressibility and the meaning of the inexpressible.
What are the five?

They are the non-existence of the unborn, the non-existence of what has already ceased, the non-existence of each other, the non-existence of non-union, and the absolute non-existence. These are the five non-existences.
Non-existence of what has not yet arisen refers to the non-existence of substance, qualities, and actions that have not yet arisen due to the non-convergence of causes and conditions.

Non-existence of what has already ceased refers to the non-existence of substance, qualities, and actions that have already ceased due to the exhaustion of causes or the arising of adverse conditions, even though they have arisen.
Mutual non-existence refers to the mutual non-existence of all substances, etc.
Non-existence of non-convergence refers to the non-existence of substances, etc. that have no nature, which have no combination or conjunction anywhere.
Absolute non-existence refers to the non-arising and non-occurrence of the three times due to the absence of causes, which is called absolute non-existence.
Among these nine substances, how many have motion and how many are without motion?
Five have motion, namely earth, water, fire, wind, and mind. Four are without motion, namely the remaining substances.
Just as there are those with motion and those without motion, those with obstruction and those without obstruction,
those with potency and those without potency, and those with mutual identity and those without mutual identity, it should be understood in the same way.
Among these nine substances, how many have qualities and how many are without qualities?
All of them have real qualities and do not lack real qualities.
Just as all have real qualities, the combination of causes and conditions has a real nature and is different.
The supporting cause that does not contradict the result is also like this.
How many of these nine realities have contact and how many are without contact?
Four have contact, namely earth, water, fire, and wind. Five are without contact, namely the remaining realities.
Just as there are those with contact and those without contact, the primary realities, the real qualities, and the real actions are also like this.
How many of these nine realities have form and how many are formless?
Three have form, namely earth, water, and fire. Six are formless, namely the remaining realities.

Just as there are those with form and those without form, those that can be seen and those that cannot be seen, those that are opposed by the eye and those that are not opposed by the eye are also like this.
Of these nine realities, five are permanent and four are distinguished.
That is to say, among these four, those that are not created are permanent, and those that are created are impermanent.
Just as there are the permanent and the impermanent, there are the real and the unreal, those with subtle divisions and those without subtle divisions, and the causes.
Non-contradictory, non-cause, non-contradictory, different from the extreme, different from the extreme, incomplete, and complete are also like this.
Thus, there are nine substances, five of which are faculties and four of which are not faculties.
Which five are faculties? They are earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

translated: These five faculties are as follows: the nose faculty is earth, the tongue faculty is water, the eye faculty is fire, the skin faculty is wind, and the ear faculty is space.
By how many qualities is earth, which is a substance, said to possess qualities?
It is said to be by fourteen.

What are the fourteen? They are color, taste, smell, touch, number, measure, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, that substance, this substance, superimposed substance, liquid substance, and action.
By how many qualities is water, which is a substance, said to possess qualities?
It is said to be by fourteen.
What are the fourteen?
They are color, taste, touch, number, measure, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, that substance, this substance, superimposed substance, liquid substance, moisture, and action.
By how many qualities is fire said to possess qualities?
It is said to be by eleven.
What are the eleven? They are color, touch, number, measure, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, otherness, identity, fluidity, and action.
By how many qualities is wind said to possess qualities?
It is said to be by nine.
What are the nine? They are number, measure, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, otherness, identity, touch, and action.
By how many qualities is space said to possess qualities?
It is said to be by six.
What are the six? They are number, measure, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, and sound.
By how many qualities is time said to possess qualities?
It is said to be by five.
What are the five? They are number, measure, separateness, conjunction, and disjunction.
Time and space are also like this.
By how many qualities is the self said to possess qualities?
It is said to be by fourteen.

What are the fourteen? One is counting, two is measuring, three is distinguishing the substance, four is combining, five is separating, six is awareness, seven is pleasure, eight is pain, nine is desire, ten is anger, eleven is diligence, twelve is dharma, thirteen is non-dharma, fourteen is action.
By how many virtues is the mind said to possess virtues?
It is said to be by eight.
What are the eight? One is counting, two is measuring, three is distinguishing the substance, four is combining, five is separating, six is its substance, seven is this substance, eight is action.
Among these twenty-four virtues such as form, etc., how many are objects of direct perception and how many are not objects of direct perception?
Form, taste, smell, and touch may be objects of direct perception or not objects of direct perception.
How are they objects of direct perception?
If they are attached to the great elements and are not single and real, they are called objects of direct perception.
How are they not objects of direct perception?
If they are attached to the ultimate atom and the result of two ultimate atoms, they are called not objects of direct perception.

Sound is all objects of direct perception, like form, taste, smell, touch, number, measure, distinguishing the substance, combining, separating, its substance, this substance, fluidity, moisture, heaviness, and power are also like this.
The cognition of pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, effort, and vigor are my present objects.
The practice of Dharma and non-Dharma is only an object that is not present.
Among these virtues, how many are products and how many are not products?
The cognition of pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, effort, vigor, Dharma, and non-Dharma, and the sound that is separate from their substance, are only products.
The rest are either products or not products.
Form, taste, smell, and touch that belong to earth are all products.
Form, taste, touch, and liquid that are extremely subtle when combined are not products.
The combination of two atoms and so forth is a product.
The substance of heaviness is also like this. As for being a product or permanent, it is the same.
As for the form and touch that belong to water and fire, and the touch that belongs to wind, it is the same.

The liquid substance that belongs to earth and fire is all a product.ğŸ”½One number, two separate substances, and that which follows the product or non-product are combined to form the product or non-product.
Two substances and so forth, one number and so forth, and the separate substance are all products.
The great body, subtle body, short body, long body, and all are products.
The round body and all are not products.
All that is obstructive and that which is both obstructive and non-obstructive are products.
Like products and non-products, the permanent and impermanent are also like this.
Among these qualities, sound, touch, color, taste, and smell are each grasped by one sense faculty.
Number, distinction, combination, separation, that substance, this substance, liquid substance, moisture, and function are grasped by eye contact.
What are the causes of these qualities?
Color, taste, smell, and touch with the same kind as cause refer to the combination of two subtle results and so forth.
Fire combination as cause refers to the color, taste, smell, and touch of all the most subtle particles of earth.
The liquid substance of earth and fire, the heavy substance of earth and water,
and the liquid substance and moisture of water are the same kind as cause for the combination of two subtle results and so forth.
One number, one distinction, and two subtle results and so forth are the same kind as cause.
The second is the cause of the same substance and different number, and the cause of the different substance and different number.
The first is the cause of the same substance and different substance, and the cause of the cognition.
The cause of the great substance and long substance is the many substances.
The cause of the great substance and long substance is the aggregation and distinction.
The cause of the subtle substance and short substance is the two substances.
The cause of the combination and separation, and the cause of the combined and separated action.
The cause of the cognition of the same time, the same substance, the same mutual dependence, the far and near.
There are two kinds of cognition, namely direct and inferential.
There are four kinds of direct cognition: 1. Doubtful cognition, 2. Certainty cognition, 3. Wrong cognition, 4. Right cognition. What is the cause of doubtful cognition?
Not the same dharma, direct perception as the precedent, waiting for the separate different memory, my intention and combination as the cause.
What is the cognition of which it is said to be doubtful cognition?
What is the cause of certainty cognition?
Doubtful cognition as the precedent, waiting for the separate different confirmation, my intention and combination as the cause.
It is definitely this cognition, called certainty cognition.
What is the cause of wrong knowledge?
It is not the same as the preceding direct perception, but rather the cause is the combination of the individual different views and my intention.
Knowledge that is dark and decisive is called wrong knowledge.
What is the cause of right knowledge?
It is not the same as the preceding direct perception, but rather the cause is the combination of the individual different direct perceptions and my intention.
Knowledge that is non-erroneous is called right knowledge.
The same applies to inference.

There are three kinds of direct perception: born from the combination of four, born from the combination of three, and born from the combination of two. What is direct perception born from the combination of four?
What is direct perception?

It refers to the knowledge of characteristics, such as color, taste, smell, touch, number, separateness, combination, disjunction, heaviness, fluidity, and motility, in relation to earth, water, fire, and air.
It is the knowledge of the nature of such activities as grasping and so forth.
Except for sound, which is a combination of the ability and inability to make sound, it is the knowledge of the nature of sound.
It is the knowledge of the existence of the ability and inability in relation to the combined parts.
The cause is the combination of the self, the sense faculty, the mind, and the object.
Born from the combination of three.
What is direct perception?

It refers to the cognition that arises from the combination of the three factors of self, mind, and sense faculties, regarding the object that possesses the nature of sound and the ability to produce sound.
What is the direct perception that arises from the combination of two factors?

It refers to the cognition that arises from the combination of self and mind, regarding the objects of pleasure, pain, desire, aversion, and effort, which possess the nature of both ability and inability.
The combination of self and mind serves as the cause.
Inferential cognition refers to the cognition that arises from the combination of two factors, preceded by the cognition that contradicts the combined single meaning.
The combination of self and mind serves as the cause, in dependence on the characteristics of combination and so forth.
The cognition of pleasure and pain arises from the combination of four, three, or two factors, in dependence on the Dharma and non-Dharma.
The cognition of desire and aversion arises from the combination of self, mind, and the recollection of pleasure and pain, in dependence on false knowledge.
The cognition of effort arises from the combination of desire, aversion, self, and mind, as well as from the cause of life force.
Because one does not desire, it serves as the cause for the activities such as inhalation and exhalation.
What serves as the cause for potency? The potency that arises from striking and throwing serves as the cause for activity.

The desire for dharma and adharma, preceded by anger, waiting for hearing and recollection, the dharma and adharma that can accomplish purity and impurity, the secret approach, the combination of self and intention, are the causes.
Recollection, the cause of practice, waiting for present and inferential knowledge, the combination of practice and self-intention, are the causes.
There are three kinds of sound: sound born from combination, sound born from separation, and sound born from sound itself.
Sound born from combination: the power of contact and substance combining, the power of contact and substance in empty space combining, are the causes.
Sound born from separation: the power of contact and substance separating, the power of contact and substance in empty space separating, are the causes.
Sound born from sound itself: the power of contact and substance combining and separating, waiting for unobstructed empty space, sound is the cause.
Among these twenty-four qualities, how many depend on one substance and how many depend on more than one substance?
Color, taste, smell, touch, quantity, their substance, this substance, cognition, pleasure,
pain, desire, anger, effort, courage, dharma, adharma, action, heaviness,
liquidity, fluidity, power, and sound - these twenty-one all depend on one substance.
Combination and separation depend on two substances.
Number may depend on one substance or more than one substance.
What is based on one real thing? It refers to the number one.
What is based on not one real thing? It refers to the number two and so forth.
The separate entities of numbers are also like this.
Among these twenty-four qualities, how many pervade the basis?
How many do not pervade the basis? Form, taste, smell, touch, number, separate entity, their entity, this entity, liquid entity, moisture, heaviness, power, and function pervade the basis.
The rest do not pervade the basis.
Among these twenty-four qualities, which are mutually contradictory?
Combination, separation, sound produced by contact, and sound produced by non-contact are mutually contradictory.
The fruits of right knowledge and happiness are mutually contradictory.
The fruits of wrong knowledge and suffering are mutually contradictory.
The fruits of all knowledge and practice are mutually contradictory.
Distinctive knowledge.
The fruits of all knowledge and practice are mutually contradictory.
The last sound is mutually contradictory with all causes.
The last quality of self is also like this.
Happiness, suffering, desire, and hatred are mutually contradictory.
The causes of Dharma and non-Dharma are mutually contradictory.
Desire, hatred, and diligence are mutually contradictory.
Pleasure and pain are mutually contradictory causes.
The same applies to the sounds in between.
The self, virtue, diligence, pain, contact, reality, and combination are mutually contradictory causes and non-causes.
The self, virtue, practice, mindfulness, cause, and pain are mutually contradictory causes and non-causes.
Practice and mindfulness are mutually contradictory causes and effects.
Making, cause, contact, reality, and combination are mutually contradictory non-causes and effects.
The two natures, etc., and the two equal awakenings are not mutually contradictory effects.
Just as the two entities, etc., and the two distinct entities, etc., their entities and this entity are also like this.
The combination of the atoms of color, taste, smell, and touch belonging to earth is not mutually contradictory with the combination of the great elements.
Combination and separation are mutually contradictory non-causes and effects.
A single real atom of color, etc., can produce a similar pair of atoms, etc., of color, etc., which are similar effects and not mutually contradictory.
The final real color, etc., which is an effect, is not mutually contradictory with the similar cause color, etc.
The intermediate real color, etc., which is a part, is not mutually contradictory with the similar cause color, etc.
The one real substance, form, etc., are not mutually results or causes, and are not contradictory.
All qualities are not contradictory with substance.
Among these twenty-four qualities, how many are real and how many are unreal?
All are real.
Just as there is reality, there are no qualities, no actions, and no causes of combination. This is the characteristic of having qualities and being real.
Being without obstruction and without subtle parts is also like this.
Among these five actions, how many are real and how many are unreal?
All are real.

Just as there is reality, there is dependence on one real substance, being without obstruction, without qualities, without subtle parts, and the cause of separation and combination. The agent and the object of action are not accumulated. This is the characteristic of reality.
The cause of action that is dependent on such things as striking and throwing is also like this.
Among these, what are the five actions and what real substances do they depend on?
The action of grasping depends on all earth, water, fire, wind, and mind.
The actions of abandoning, moving, and acting are also like this.
The fruit of the extreme extension, slowness, and subtle division of contraction is the great long reality that is relied upon.
Like the work of contraction, the work of extension is also like this.
How many of these five works are universally based and how many are not universally based?
All are universally based.
Some say that the mind that relies on the extreme atom is universally based.
Those that rely on two atoms and so forth are not universally based.
Thus, if these works are internal,
the body and the causes and conditions of the body, the nose, taste, skin, eye faculties, and the mind all serve as the causes and conditions for combination.
Among these, the first work of the body takes desire as the foremost, and the combination of effort serves as the cause and condition for non-combination.
The second and so forth also take action as the cause and condition for non-combination.
Like the work of the body, the mind and subtle division work are also like this.
The first work of the nose, taste, and skin takes the combination of the self and effort, and the combination of the body as the cause and condition for non-combination.
The second and so forth also take action as the cause and condition for non-combination.
The actions of the nose and so forth are in the pestle and so forth, as well as in the body-dependent garlands, necklaces, and anointments.
The action of falling asleep is the first.
Using heaviness as the cause of non-coalescence.
The second and so forth use the heavy body as the cause of non-coalescence.
The action of the in-breath and out-breath of a sleeping person, or of a sleeping person.
The first, because of desire, uses the life-conditions as the foremost, and my coalescence with vigor as the cause of non-coalescence.
The second and so forth also use action as the cause of non-coalescence.
Like a flowing stream, the first uses liquidity as the cause of non-coalescence.
The second and so forth use the liquid action as the cause of non-coalescence.
The first of the burning fire and the blowing wind,
uses the Dharma and non-Dharma, and my coalescence as the cause of non-coalescence.
The second and so forth are as previously explained.
The first action of the great elements and atoms that create the body,
uses the Dharma and non-Dharma, and my coalescence as the cause of non-coalescence.
The second and following are as explained before.
Just as for creating the body, for creating trees, etc., the transformation and the action in two atoms, etc., are also like this.
The first action of intention and turning away is
taking dharmas and non-dharmas as the cause of combination and non-combination.
The second and following are as explained before.
The first action of the earth and feet indicating the benefit and harm of sentient beings is
taking dharmas and non-dharmas as the cause of combination and non-combination.
The second and following are as explained before.
The action of throwing and striking in the earth, water, and fire realms takes the heavy substance, liquid substance, diligence, and power of effort as the cause of non-combination.
As appropriate, there is the action of grasping, etc.
If in the fire, exclude the heavy substance; if in the wind, exclude the liquid substance; if in the mind, exclude the throwing and striking.
Is such an existent to be made or not to be made?
It is definitely not to be made.
Just as it is not to be made, it is also permanent, without qualities, without activity, and without subtle parts.
There is a real substance, virtue, and action, excluding the same, having the ability, not having the ability, and the different that are combined into one, having the same expressive cause.
There is a difference from the real substance, relying on one real substance to block the other, the cause of cognition manifests this cause of cognition, only when empty, time changes.
The cause of the conception of space, etc., is always not made, has no virtue, has no movement, has no subtle parts.
Excluding the same, having the nature of existence, having the ability, not having the ability, and the different that are combined into one, not one.
The combination is one, always not made, has no subtle parts, and is not obstructive.
All real substances, virtues, and actions, the same, different, having the ability, not having the ability, and the different that are born, the cause of the same expressive condition.
In this way, having the ability is made by this, and is not made.
It is definitely not made.
Like what is not made, it is always without virtue, without movement, without subtle parts, and without obstruction.

On the real substances, virtues, and actions, each separately excludes the same, having the ability, not having the ability, and the different that are combined into one, not the same expressive condition.
This is called having the ability, not having the ability, and also like this.
The real nature that is common to both is the single real meaning of the category of reality.
It is without obstruction, without subtle parts, without movement, without qualities, eternal, and not produced.
The various realities mutually combine with this, and it is different from qualities and actions.
The natures of qualities, actions, earth, etc. are also like this.
Among these five kinds of meanings that are not spoken of, how many are eternal and how many are impermanent?
Non-existence that has not yet arisen is impermanent, because it is contrary to the arising of reality, qualities, and actions.
Non-existence that has already ceased, mutual non-existence, and absolute non-existence are all eternal, because they are not contrary to reality, etc.
Non-existence of non-combination is both eternal and impermanent.
How is it eternal? For example, the reality of earth, etc. is not combined with other qualities.
If the nature of reality, etc. is the same, or if there is a difference in ability, except for its own basis, it is not combined with other places.
If there is a nature that is not combined with the same, etc.,
how is it impermanent? It means that although reality and reality are not yet combined, they will certainly be combined in the future. This is non-existence.
If something real has real qualities and actions, they must necessarily be combined with it.
In this way, how many of the five non-existences are objects of direct perception and how many are not objects of direct perception?
All are not objects of direct perception and do not rely on others to arise, but are objects of inferential cognition.
How many of these ten meanings are knowable and how many are not knowable?
All are knowable and are also this.
Reason for expression.
One fascicle of the Ten Categories of the Supreme School
